configuration.dashboardSubtitle: India's Contributions, Global Context & Institutional Landscape

summary.title: Executive Summary: Impact at a Glance
insights: India's ML researchers are making their mark with 50 papers at ICLR 2025, including 5 spotlight and 2 oral presentations that demonstrate the quality of research.
Positioned globally, India contributes 1.3% to the body of work at ICLR 2025.
Analysis of 26 first authorship and 23 majority authorship collaborations reveals trends in research leadership and international collaboration.
The India ML research landscape shows a mix of 17 academic and 11 corporate contributions, with leading institutions demonstrating significant research impact.

context.title: Global & APAC Context: India's Standing
context.subtitle: Comparing India's research output with global and regional peers.
insights: The top 5 contributing countries were: United States, China, HK, GB, Canada.

focusCountry.title: Deep Dive into India's representation at ICLR 2025
focusCountry.subtitle: Analyzing authorship, collaboration, and institutional contributions.
insights: India has a strong presence at ICLR 2025 with 50 accepted papers, including 5 spotlights and 2 orals, showcasing notable contributions to the field.
With 133 unique authors and significant first (26 papers) and majority authorship (23 papers), India demonstrates growing research leadership.
The healthy mix of 17 academic and 11 corporate institutions highlights the diverse and collaborative nature of India's ML ecosystem.
To further enhance impact, increasing the number of oral presentations could be a focus, signifying a greater proportion of highly-rated, impactful research.

institutions.title: Institutions: Internal Ecosystem
institutions.subtitle: Analyzing the performance and impact of individual institutions within India.
insights: IIT Bombay was the top contributing institution from India with 10 papers.
India had 17 academic and 11 corporate institutions contributing to ICLR 2025.
